pros: They have been through a lot recently but moving positively to making the organisation great
cons: I haven’t seen any negatives

review_title: Overall a great place to work
pros: Feminist leadership So many talented staff
cons: Balance of the principles with the efficacy

review_title: Flexible employment in organisation working to live by its values
pros: Flexible working Commitment to organisational values - we are not feminist or anti racist yet but we have progressed and there is commitment to living by values Strong organisational history of challenging how INGO work and shifting power to communities and the organisations (inside AA Fed and outside) that work alongside them. Among the first INGO to Federate (2003) building on substantial power shifts in 90s.
cons: Decision making- everything takes an age Prioritisation - lack of, leading to high workloads Internal tensions over pace of change - anti racism and feminism. Tensions particularly bad between teams accountable for bringing in public fundraising and colleagues in comms and policy roles. Interactions often negative and accusatory rather than constructive.

pros: Good organisation helping those in need.
cons: Not sure really as they are no different from other charities trying to do good work.

pros: Flexible hours, generous leave, friendly colleagues
cons: Some internal politics and poor senior management

pros: The ActionAid federation will introduce you to some amazing people around the world.
cons: The organisation struggles a bit with its current ambition to shift power and control out of Europe.

pros: Decent pay for 3rd sector
cons: Long list of cons ***

pros: There is a lot of travel opportunity to see the world and experience different cultures with Actoinaid locations around the world
cons: Project Accountant role has little career advancement opportunities

review_title: Good Working Culture and Environment that work together to achieve a common goal
pros: Company achieves goals it has set out,,which is to contribute to the Development of the Host Country by engaging in Programmes that empower the local people. To fight social injustice and end hunger.
cons: Not so involved as an intern

pros: Great cause, some really lovely people
cons: Can end up working in siloes at time

pros: I really enjoy working at ActionAid. They really look after us and the benfits reflect this in terms of flexible working and self care days
cons: None that I can think of?

job_title: Senior Data Analyst in London, England
pros: There were some great people in the teams
cons: Lack of strategy from leadership and a poor company culture because of that

pros: Great colleagues and nice atmosphere, work/life balance is good
cons: inflated middle management who think they run the place

review_title: Stimulating environment and great core mission
pros: Amazing culture + values, Creative, sense of purpose, clear mission, trust, great staff, dedicated to making a difference.
cons: Salary, NGO working environment can at times feel precarious

Great people

hierarchical

pros: Good culture and a great cause to work for
cons: Some issues with higher management

pros: good not too bad ok
cons: too process oriented slow moving

job_title: Director of Operations in London, England
pros: Good cause and great colleagues. Good training opportunities
cons: Lower than average salaries. No clear career path progression for some roles

pros: Broad and diverse workforce across all departments
cons: Not everyone is properly a humanitarian or development specialist, which leads to a lot of mission creep and fuzzy goal-setting

pros: Some Flexible working, good team members
cons: Position can be demoted at any time.

pros:
Great cause
Caring staff
Dedicated management

review_title: Some nice people but terrible leadership team
pros: Nice benefits and some great people
cons: Leadership team are poor and the organisation is slowly getting worse

job_title: Head of Marketing in London, England
pros: Good work life balance, great cause
cons: Poor leadership at slt level with lack of strategic directions

pros: Focus on organisational effectiveness was good
cons: No opportunities for growth unfortunately

review_title: Interesting work with an ambitious organisation
pros:
- International staff have a lot of flexibility in terms of organising their work day and deciding on the focus of their work
- Organisation tries very hard to ensure women are employed and there is flexibility to allow them to combine work with their caregiving role at home
- Inspiring vision and strategy
cons:
- Funding challenges put pressure on staff (doing the same amount of more work with less people)
- Few growth opportunities
- Inequality of benefits between country offices and staff within country offices (international versus local staff salaries, duration maternity leave)

review_title: Terrible senior management and leadership team.
pros: ActionAid is a fantastic cause which helps thousands of people in the most vulnerable of communities and climates. The staff at management level and below are a fantastic bunch. The pay structure is favourable, although there is presently a pay-freeze for existing staff at a certain level.
cons: Senior management at 'head of' level is poor, many of whom who are ego driven (particularly in comms and fundraising). H.R leadership is terrible, which often means issues remain unresolved / ignored. There are hardly any senior managers in on a Friday, which causes delays and impacts morale. Planning is often short-sighted and delivered in such a way to please certain directors, no matter how realistic.

pros: AAUK a good cause - helps thousands of people in the most vulnerable of communities and climates. Pay structure is favourable and some good benefits.
cons:
Senior management is very ego driven.  
Lacking in H.R leadership.   Some heads seem to never be around especially on a Friday where there is no senior managers to be seen at all.  People are not treated fairly and not consistent.  An aggressive management style is used.  Many departments are disengaged.  Not a great place to work.

job_title: Senior Fundraising Manager in London, England
pros:
*NB this is for ActionAid UK not ActionAid International*
- Extremely approachable and visible CEO
- Whole charity subscribes to feminist leadership principles
- Attract really good talent so teams are high achieving
- Great social life
cons: It can be hard to match job titles to roles with other charities and therefore understand your seniority. I would ask to see an organogram if one isn’t provided ahead of interview/offer

review_title: Disappointingly treated by senior management with no real strategic insight
pros: Mission and objectives; work at delivery level; passion and loyalty of supporters; campaigning. Staff commitment.
cons: Appalling senior management team in uk - total lack of leadership and dreadful handling of redundancy and restructuring. No idea how to be strategic. Feel like they are playing and are in their own little bubble.

review_title: Great cause, great work, poor personnel management
pros:
Inspiring cause and sustainable model of development
Moderate focus on employee development - in-house generic training
cons:
Poorly handled restructures and corporate change
Inadequate management of workplace issues and poor performance
Really high turnover
Lack of direction and worrying lack of leadership at most senior levels

pros: The cause is brilliant, you get to meet people from all over the world who work for the movement.
cons: Management is really poor (especially in Comms) and HR don't support staff. Unfortunately, we saw staff made redundant when heads of team decided they didn't like them. Very sad really - and the HR team at ActionAid UK just sit by and watch.

pros:
Transparency 
Friendly staff 
Open door policy
Relaxed and productive atmosphere 
Flexibility
Free coffee!!
Lots of holidays
cons: A lot of junk food around

pros: Values, colleagues, office, travel opportunities
cons: Salaries could be higher but its an NGO
